intro: Brachystelma albipilosum, commonly known as the white-hair stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine white hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale pink or white, blooming in late winter or early spring. This species is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun and requiring minimal water.
